intro: Verticordia lepidophylla var. lepidophylla, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Marsupial Orchid, is a distinctive member of the family Rhamnaceae, native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and its unique, spike-like inflorescence that bears small, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in heathland or open forest environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and they bloom during the warmer months, attracting a variety of pollinators. This species is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region, with periods of drought tolerance and seasonal flowering.
